We need to update @fig-placeholder to a better one in the future!
One way to do this, perhaps, is by using `R` code.
Here's an example:

```{r}
#| label: fig-r-example
#| fig-cap: "A histogram of random normal data"
#| out-width: 100%
library(ggplot2)
data.frame(x = rnorm(1000)) |>
  ggplot(aes(x)) +
  geom_histogram() +
  theme_minimal()
```
